revision.text:
'''Meno Fortas''' is a theatrical production facility and theater group in [[Vilnius]] formed and directed by [[Lithuania]]n [[Eimuntas Nekrošius]] since 1998. It was specifically created for the production of works under this director, but is also active in the formation of young theater arts professionals and the promotion of Lithuanian theatre tradition both at home and abroad. The institution does not have its own theater and performs heavily abroad at theatre festivals. The institution is known for its streamlined stagings, heavy on metaphor, with most of its stories based on known plays, including major works by [[Shakespeare]], [[Anton Chekov]] and [[Fyodor Dostoyevsky]]. These productions are an extension of Nekrošius’s directing career which began in the 1970s. ==The institution== Meno fortas was formed in 1998 as a private, non-profit institution by Eimuntas Nekrošius, [[Nadežda Gultiajeva]] and The Ministry of Culture of the [[Lithuania|Republic of Lithuania]].<ref name="introduction"> {{cite web |url= http://www.menofortas.lt/index.php?id=245 |title= Introduction |date=25 September 2011 |publisher=Meno Forte }} </ref> (shorthis) The name translates to “fortress of art,” and applies to the Vilnius-based production facility as well as the theater company.<ref name="otelo"> {{cite news |title= El Otelo de la compañía Meno Fortas destaca el drama de la vida del hombre |author= Merry MacMasters |url= http://www.jornada.unam.mx/2007/10/07/index.php?section=cultura&article=a06n1cul |newspaper=La Jornada |location=Mexico City |date=October 7, 2007 |accessdate=September 25, 2011 |language=Spanish |trans-title=Othello of the Meno Fortas company highlights the drama of the man’s life }} </ref><ref name="nakas"> {{cite journal |last= Nakas |first= Kestutis |date=May–June 2007 |title= The Lions of Lithuanian Theatre |journal=American Theatre |volume=24 |issue=5 |pages=54–59 }} </ref> The focus of the institution is to produce works created and/or directed by Lithuanian director Eimuntas Nekrošius in Lithuania and abroad. Most of these works represent Lithuanian theatrical tradition and are promoted by the company to a wider audience. However, it also works to on collaborative projects with other institutions, training young theater artists, organize various types of cultural events financed by both public and private monies.<ref name="introduction"/><ref name="shorthis"> {{cite web |url= http://etu.szinhaz.org/english/menofortas.shtml |title= Meno Fortas |publisher= Union des Theatres del Europe |accessdate= September 25, 2011 }}{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} </ref> Meno Fortas has been a member of the [[Union of the Theatres of Europe]] since 2000.<ref name="shorthis"/>
There are different artists working constantly in the studio, chamber concerts and performances are taking place here as well. After 2007, the group added chamber theatre to its repertoire.<ref name="introduction"/> Meno Fortas does not have its own building, but rather rents space for its offices and rehearsal rooms and performances are held in rented theatres.<ref name="shorthis"/> The company performs about fifty times a year outside of the country, mostly of works such as Song of Songs, The Seasons by [[Kristijonas Donelaitis]] and the Shakespeare trilogy of [[Hamlet]], [[Macbeth]] and [[Othello]].<ref name="propuesta"> {{cite news |title= Llega al Cervantino la propuesta escénica de Meno Fortas |newspaper=NOTIMEX |location=Mexico City |date=October 27, 2010 |language=Spanish |trans-title=The purposeful scenery of Meno Fortas arrives to the Cervantino }} </ref> The group is part of strong theatre scene in that exists in the capital of Vilnius despite the country’s poverty. It also has a very strong tradition of the theater being dominated by its directors.<ref name="nakas"/> == Eimuntas Nekrošius== Eimuntas Nekrošius, born 1952, is a graduate of the [[Russian Academy of Theatre Arts|Lunacharsky Art Institute]] (today Russian Academy of Theatre Arts) in [[Moscow]].<ref name="artact"> {{cite web |url= http://www.artactmagazine.ro/eimuntas-nekrosius1.html |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20101021065435/http://www.artactmagazine.ro/eimuntas-nekrosius1.html |dead-url= yes |archive-date= October 21, 2010 |title= Eimuntas Nekrosius |date= April 16, 2010 |publisher= Art Act Magazine |location= Romania |accessdate= September 25, 2011 }} </ref> He began is directing career as the “[[enfant terrible]]” of the [[Vilnus State Youth Theater]], working there from 1978 to 1991, with a short stint from 1979 to 1980 at the [[Kaunas National Drama Theatre]].<ref name="artact"/><ref name="nakas"/> During the [[USSR|Soviet era]], major works that he produced include such as ''The Square'' by Yeliseyeva in 1980, L''ove and Death in Verona'' by Antanėlis and Geda (1982), ''Pirosmani, Pirosmani, A Day Longer Than a Hundred Years'' by Aitmatov (1983) and ''[[Uncle Vanya]]'' by Chekhov (1986).<ref name="artact"/><ref name="nakas"/> Of these the two most important were ''The Square'' and ''Uncle Vanya''. In the first, life in prison was measured by counting sugar cubes, which audiences interpreted as a metaphor for Soviet life and in the latter, Astrov’s maps were tiny postage stamps, which Yelena viewed through a very large magnifying screen.<ref name="nakas"/><ref name="eimuntas"> {{cite web |url= http://www.menofortas.lt/en/nekrosius |title= Eimuntas Nekrošius |date=25 September 2011 |publisher=Meno Forte }} </ref> This performance of Uncle Vanya broke the tradition of staging this play set by [[Constantin Stanislavski]] .<ref name="stpete"> {{cite web |url= http://petersburgcity.com/news/culture/2003/10/21/menofortas/ |title= The XII Union of European theatres Festival brings the works of Eimuntas Nekroshius to the city |first= |date=October 21, 2003 |publisher= PetersburgCity.com |location=St. Petersburg, Russia |accessdate=September 25, 2011 }} </ref> His performances produced by the LIFE Festival include ''Mozart and Salieri'', ''Don Juan'', ''Plague'' by Pushkin (1994), ''Three Sisters'' by Chekhov (1995) and ''Love and Death in Verona'' (1996), all of which were also presented at various international theater festivals.<ref name="artact"/> This work popularized a new trend in Lithuanian theatre based on poetry and metaphor, with the main focus on psychology and emotion with relatively plastic acting. Scenery, while sparse, is important to give multiple layers to the use of metaphor.<ref name="stpete"/> Nekrošius has continued with this style of production as founder and director of Meno Fortas, founded 1998.<ref name="eimuntas"/><ref name="artact"/> The director has received a number of awards for his work include best stage director of the year by Lithuanian Critique, the New Reality in Europe Theater by the Europe Theater Union and the Taormina Art Festival committee and the UBU Premium of [[Italy]].<ref name="stpete"/>
==Productions and performances== Menos Forte has continued with Nekrošius streamlined, metaphoric staging. One example of this style is seen in the group’s production of [[Faust]]. Its depiction of Faust is marked by the main character slowly walking downstage as other actors are flicking ropes to makes waves in yellow light. When in the middle of them, he panics, grabs his heart and falls. The ropes then cover Faust.<ref name="nakas"/>
Meno Forte’s shows are financed as international co-productions and are presented more often abroad than in Lithuania.<ref name="nakas"/><ref name="introduction"/> One of its signature pieces, ''Hamlet'', actually precedes the group as it was first performed at the LIFE Festival in 1997, being performed there for five year in a row. However, the characteristics of this piece would define Meno Fortas, as it starred a Lithuanian pop singer in the title role and featured a huge, melting chandelier made of ice hovering over the scene.<ref name="nakas"/><ref name="shorthis"/> The piece has been performed by the group in nearly all of Europe’s main theatre festivals, winning many awards.<ref name="artact"/>
Macbeth was created after the formation of the theater group, premiering in 1999.<ref name="shorthis"/> In 2001, Othello was first premiered at the [[Venice Biennale]], followed by the first opera Macbeth at the Teatro Comunale in [[Florence]].<ref name="artact"/><ref name="otelo"/> The three Shakespeare pieces, ''Hamlet'', ''Macbeth'' and ''Othello'' are heavily dependent on the performance of the actor in the title role. This reliance on a single main actor has forced the company to cancel shows when this actor cannot perform.<ref name="cancela"> {{cite news |title= La compañía Meno Fortas cancela el montaje de Hamlet en el FIC |author= Fabiola Palapa Quijas |url= http://www.jornada.unam.mx/2008/10/10/index.php?section=cultura&article=a06n1cul |newspaper=La Jornada |location=Mexico City |date=October 9, 2008 |accessdate=September 25, 2011 |language=Spanish |trans-title=The Meno Fortas company cancels its showing of Hamlet at the FIC }} </ref>
Other productions include a version of [[Pedro Calderón de la Barca|Pedro Calderón’s]] ''La vida es sueño'' with the Compañía Estable of [[Colombia]], [[Cornamusa, SA]] of [[Mexico]] and [[Teatro 4]] of [[Argentina]].<ref name="cancela"/>
In 2003, the company created a production called ''The Seasons'', based on an epic poem by Lithuanian writer [[Kristijonas Donelaitis]]. In the same year, a production of Anton Chekov’s ''The Cherry Orchard'' was produced with Russian actors.<ref name="artact"/>
In 2004, the company produced a play based on the Old Testament called ''The Song of Songs'',<ref name="artact"/> and ''the Cherry Orchard'' received the top prize at the [[Golden Mask (Russian award)|Golden Mask Festival]] in Moscow.<ref name="nakas"/>
In 2005, two operas were produced called the ''Children of Rosenthal'' by [[Leonid Desyatnikov]] at the [[Bolshoi Theater]] in Moscow and ''Boris Godunov'' at the Teatro Comunale in Florence.<ref name="artact"/>
Another major work by the group is called ''[[Faust]]'', base on the version by Johan Wolfgang.<ref name="artact"/> This piece has been performed for various years in various countries including the [[Festival Internacional Cervantino in Mexico]].<ref name="propuesta"/> Another 2006 production is ''Valkyrie'', based on [[Ride of the Valkyries|the musical piece by Richard Wagner]], and which was staged at the [[Lithuanian National Opera and Ballet Theater]] in 2007.<ref name="artact"/>
In 2008, the company performed ''[[Anna Karenina]]'' at the Emilia Romagna Teatro in [[Modena]] and an opera called ''The Legend of Invisible city of [[Kitez]]'', at the [[Teatro Lirico di Cagliari]] and Bolshoi Theater.<ref name="artact"/>
The most recent production by the company include a large scale show based on [[Fyodor Dostoyevsky]]’s ''[[The Idiot]]''.<ref name="artact"/>
==References== {{reflist}}
[[Category:Culture in Vilnius]] [[Category:Theatre in Lithuania]]

revision.text:
'''The Moscow State Academy of Choreography''' ({{lang-ru|Московская государственная академия хореографии}}, commonly known as '''The Bolshoi Ballet Academy''', is one of the oldest and most prestigious schools of ballet in the world,<ref>http://www.latimes.com/news/education/la-me-bolshoi5-2008oct05,0,792289.story?track=rss</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.balletacademy.ru/eng/page-process_eng1.htm |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2017-12-29 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130405014010/http://www.balletacademy.ru/eng/page-process_eng1.htm |archivedate=2013-04-05 |df= }}</ref> located in [[Moscow]], Russia. It is the affiliate school of the [[Bolshoi Ballet]].
The Bolshoi Ballet receives the majority of its dancers from the Academy, as do most other Moscow ballet companies. Numerous choreographers, instructors and graduates of the academy have become renowned in [[Russian ballet]] and internationally, including [[Olga Lepeshinskaya (dancer)|Olga Lepeshinskaya]], [[Raisa Struchkova]], [[Natalia Bessmertnova]], [[Ekaterina Maximova]], [[Maya Plisetskaya]], [[Nikolai Fadeyechev]], [[Vladimir Vasiliev (dancer)|Vladimir Vasiliev]], [[Mikhail Lavronsky]], [[Nikolay Tsiskaridze]], to be bestowed a [[People's Artist of the USSR]], "[[prima ballerina assoluta]]" and "premier dancer", the ultimate title for a ballet performer of the [[Soviet Union]].
==History== Bolshoi is the oldest theatrical school in [[Moscow]], founded as an orphanage by order of [[Catherine the Great|Catherine II]] in 1763. It wasn't until 1773 that the first dance classes were taught at the home. Other names the school is known by are: '''The Bolshoi Academy''', '''The Bolshoi Ballet School''', '''The Moscow Choreographic Institute''', '''The Moscow Ballet School''', '''The Bolshoi Moscow Ballet School''' and '''The Bolshoi Theatre Ballet School'''.
Heads:<ref>[http://www.balletacademy.ru/www/leader.shtml The Moscow State Academy of Choreography] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110929165302/http://www.balletacademy.ru/www/leader.shtml |date=2011-09-29 }}</ref>
* 1773—1777 — [[Filippo Beccari]] * 1778—1783 — [[Leopold Paradise]] * 1783—1805 — [[Cosimo Morelli (choreographer)]] * 1806—1808 — [[Jean Lamiral]] * 1808—1811 — [[Dominique Lefèvre]] * 1811—1839 — [[Adam Glushkovskiy]] * 1839—1846 — [[Konstantin Bordanov]] (ru: Богданов, Константин Федорович) * 1846—1850 — [[Feodor Manokhin]] (ru: Манохин, Фёдор Николаевич) * 1851—1857 — ? * 1858—1869 — [[Feodor Manokhin]] (ru: Манохин, Фёдор Николаевич) * 1869—1872 — [[Pierre Frédéric Malavergne]] * 1872—1874 — [[Gustave Legat]] * 1874—1883 — [[Sergey Petrovich Sokolov]] (ru: Соколов, Сергей Петрович) * 1883—1898 — [[Aleksey Bogdanov]] (ru: Богданов, Алексей Николаевич) * 1898—1902 — [[Vasiliy Geltser]] (ru: Гельцер, Василий Федорович) * 1902—1907 — [[Alexander Alexeyevich Gorsky]] * 1907—1917 — [[Vasiliy Tikhomirov]] (ru: Тихомиров, Василий Дмитриевич) * 1917—1924 — Alexander Alexeyevich Gorsky * 1924 — 1931 — ? * 1931—1936 — [[Viktor Aleksandrovich Semeonov]] (ru: Семёнов, Виктор Александрович) * 1937—1941 — [[Pyotr Gusev]] * 1942—1945 — [[Nikolay Ivanovich Tarasov]] (ru: Тарасов, Николай Иванович) * 1945—1947 — [[Rostislav Zakharov]] * 1948—1953 — [[Leonid Lavrovskiy]] * 1953—1954 — Nikolay Ivanovich Tarasov * 1954—1958 — [[Michail Gabovich]] (ru: Габович, Михаил Маркович) * 1959—1964 — [[Yuriy Kondratov]] (ru: Кондратов, Юрий Григорьевич) * 1960—2001 — [[Sofia Golovkina]] (ru: Головкина, Софья Николаевна) * 1964—1967 — Leonid Lavrovskiy * 1968—1972 — [[Aleksey Yermolayev]] * 1973—1987 — [[Maksim Martirosian]] (ru: Мартиросян, Максим Саакович) * 1988—1993 — [[Igor Uksusnikov]] (ru: Уксусников, Игорь Валентинович) * 2001—2002 — [[Boris Akimov]] (ru: Акимов, Борис Борисович) * 2002 — [[Marina Leonova]] (ru: Леонова, Марина Константиновна)
==Method and education== The Bolshoi's method of teaching is founded on a thorough, comprehensive, classical training curriculum that is carefully coordinated to the students' ability. The curriculum includes Ballet Technique, Pointe Work, Centre Work, Repertoire, Pas de Deux, Jazz, Character Dance and Historical Dance. The Academy offers a professional teaching staff with international teaching and performing experience.All classes are carefully graded both for age and technical level and each student is given the individual attention so necessary for his or her progress. At the school, children from ages nine to eighteen attend academic classes in addition to their rigorous dance training, using the [[Vaganova method]]. Many of them live at the in-house school dormitories.
The Bolshoi Ballet Academy holds annual auditions for the students seeking acceptance into the full-time programs of traineeship and vocational training. The director of the academy is currently, [[Marina Leonova]].
==Facilities== The Bolshoi Ballet Academy offers one of the best dance training facilities in the world. Amenities including twenty large studios with a professional non-slip dance floor, changing rooms with showers and lockers, study area, and a physiotherapy room. High ceilings make it possible to offer Pas de Deux classes, and two levels of ballet barres are provided for young children and adults.
==Alumni==
The Bolshoi is the school from which the [[Bolshoi Ballet]] gets the majority of its dancers, as well as most other Moscow ballet companies. The Academy has graduated a long list of acclaimed ballerinas and danseurs, including, but not limited to:
{{col-begin}}
{{col-1-of-3}} *[[Maria Alexandrova]] *[[Nina Ananiashvili]] *[[Dmitry Belogolovtsev]] *[[Natalia Bessmertnova]] *[[Nikolai Fadeyechev]] *[[Sergei Filin]] *[[Yekaterina Geltzer]] *[[Nadezhda Gracheva]] *[[Dmitry Gudanov]] *[[:ru:Дроздова, Маргарита Сергеевна|Margarita Drozdova]] *[[:ru:Кондратьева, Марина Викторовна|Marina Kondratyeva]] *[[Maria Kochetkova]] *[[:ru:Андрианов, Александр Олегович|Alexander Andrianov]] *[[:ru:Мельниченко, Элина Александровна|Elina Melnichenko]]
{{col-2-of-3}} *[[Mikhail Lavronsky]] *[[Olga Lepeshinskaya (dancer)|Olga Lepeshinskaya]] *[[:ru:Лиепа, Илзе Марисовна|Ilze Liepa]] *[[Andris Liepa]] *[[Maris Liepa]] *[[Svetlana Lunkina]] *[[Vladimir Malakhov (dancer)|Vladimir Malakhov]] *[[Xenia Makletzova]] *[[Ekaterina Maximova]] *[[Asaf Messerer]] *[[:ru:Михальченко, Алла Анатольевна|Alla Mikhalchenko]] *[[Igor Moiseyev]] *[[Mikhail Mordkin]] *[[Irek Mukhamedov]]
{{col-3-of-3}} *[[Anastasia Nabokina]] *[[Natalia Osipova]] *[[Maya Plisetskaya]] *[[Alexander Plisetski]] *[[Polina Semionova]] *[[Nina Sorokina]] *[[:ru:Степаненко, Галина Олеговна|Galina Stepanenko]] *[[Raisa Struchkova]] *[[Vasily Tikhomirov]] *[[Nikolai Tsiskaridze]] *[[Vladimir Vasiliev (dancer)|Vladimir Vasiliev]] *[[:ru:Уваров, Андрей Иванович|Andrey Uvarov]]
{{col-end}}
==Summer intensive== The Ballet Academy partners with the Russian American Foundation to hold annual summer intensives in [[New York City]], United States, and Middlebury, CT. It is held in facilities at [[Lincoln Center]]. During the summer intensive, a few students are chosen to participate in a Gala Performance in Moscow or to enroll full-time at the Academy in Moscow.
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.balletacademy.ru Official website] {{ru icon}} *[http://portal.unesco.org/culture/en/ev.php-URL_ID=20037&URL_DO=DO_PRINTPAGE&URL_SECTION=201.html The Moscow State Academy of Choreography]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} page at [[UNESCO]] *[http://www.bolshoiballetacademy.com/ Summer Intensive in New York City]
{{Ballet schools}}

revision.text:
{{Infobox company | name = Mrs P Enterprises, LLC | logo = }}
'''MrsP.com''' is a free children's entertainment website. It stars actress [[Kathy Kinney]] as Mrs. P, a redheaded Irishwoman who reads classic children's stories from her "Magic Library." The target audience for the website is kids between the ages of 3-12, and its goal is to "encourage a lifetime love of reading." <ref>International BusinessTimes Online http://www.ibtimes.com/prnews/20081110/sitcom-star-debuts-comic-kids-show-to-promote-love-of-reading.htm Retrieved on 2008-11-10.</ref> It has no advertising and no subscription fees. The site is produced by Mrs P Enterprises, LLC and was created by Kinney, who played Mimi on ''[[The Drew Carey Show]]'', TV writer and producer [[Clay Graham]], and former entertainment and New Media executive Dana Plautz.
== Content == The primary content offered on MrsP.com is a library of [[streaming video]] episodes. The episodes range in length from 5–30 minutes and feature the Mrs. P character seated near a fire in her "Magic Library." She offers a short, often humorous introduction, usually based on one of her youthful adventures and related in some way to the story she is about to read. She then reads the story directly to the camera. The videos include illustrations or photographs, but focus primarily on the emotive performances of the storyteller "in the hope that viewers will use their imaginations." <ref name=Carpenter2010>[[Susan Carpenter]], "Mrs. P has a story for you, kids" http://www.latimes.com/technology/la-et-mrs-p10-2008nov10,1,2661628.story Los Angeles Times, 2008-11-10.</ref>
'''Stories''' read by Mrs. P on the website include ''[[Jack and the Beanstalk]]'', ''[[Little Red Riding Hood]]'', ''[[The Tale of Peter Rabbit]]'' and ''[[Sleeping Beauty]]''.<ref>MrsP.com, online video library http://www.mrsp.com Retrieved on 2008-11-11.</ref> New stories are added every few weeks.
The site also features an animated game in which a stuffed dog, Spyri, comes to life, as well as a "window" in which various visitors appear, including actor Robert Blanche (''[[World Trade Center (film)|World Trade Center]]'', ''[[Ghost Whisperer]]'') as a singing policeman trying to woo Mrs. P.<ref>MrsP.com, Credits http://www.mrsp.com Retrieved on 2008-11-10.</ref>
== History == Development of MrsP.com began in April 2007, when [[Clay Graham]], who had been the head writer and an executive producer of ''[[The Drew Carey Show]]'', first had the idea of creating a "storytelling" website. Dana Plautz, who had been a marketing executive at [[Hanna-Barbera]], joined soon after as a partner and co-president, and they approached [[Kathy Kinney]], who was their "first -- and only -- choice" to play Mrs. P.<ref name=Carpenter2010/> Kinney also is co-president and co-creator of the website.<ref>MrsP.com, Credits http://www.mrsp.com Retrieved on 2008-11-10.</ref>
The site launched at midnight on November 10, 2008. Its production offices are in [[Portland, Oregon]] and [[Los Angeles]]. [[Powell's Books]], the world's largest [[independent bookstore]], supports the site with a "Mrs. P Aisle" on its website, [http://www.powells.com www.powells.com], and with other promotional activities.<ref>Powell's Bookstore Online http://www.powells.com Retrieved on 2008-11-11.</ref>
Mrs. P made her first national TV appearance on Dec. 6, 2008 in a live broadcast from the Manhattan [[FAO Schwarz]] Toy Store for the [[CBS]] ''[[Early Show]]''. She recommended her favorite children's books for the holiday season and read ''[[The Princess and the Pea]]'' to an audience of children.<ref>[http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2008/12/05/earlyshow/series/perfect_holiday/main4651497.shtml cbsnews.com, "Mrs. P's Picks:Best Children's Books"]</ref>
On December 9, 2008, MrsP.com began offering videos from its library for purchase and download on the [[iTunes Store]]. Ten percent of all MrsP.com's after-tax profits will be donated by Mrs P Enterprises, LLC to literacy organizations.<ref>[https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=conewsstory&refer=conews&tkr=AAPL%3AUS&sid=aVznMVBC5T4U Bloomberg.com, "Mrs. P Reads Classic Children's Stories on iTunes."]</ref>
Mrs. P made an appearance at the Los Angeles Times Festival of Books, the nation's largest book fair, on April 25, 2009. She read to a crowd of several hundred children and parents from the Target-sponsored Children's Stage.<ref>[http://www.press.mrsp.com/news.asp MrsP.com Press Website]</ref>
On April 27, 2009, MrsP.com won the National Parenting Center Seal of Approval. In its review, the Center called the website "beautifully conceived" and "beautifully rendered," adding that "the site felt extremely genuine in its desire to help children develop a love of reading and did so by creating a fun environment for them" in which to be read to.<ref>[http://www.tnpc.com/search/tnpcarticle2.asp?rec=6263 The National Parenting Center website, "MrsP.com Review, Spring 2009]</ref>
TeachersFirst.com, a website resource "by teacher, for teachers" reviewed MrsP.com in May, 2009, stating "You almost want to toast marshmallows on the open fire as you cyber-curl under Mrs. P's feet by the fireplace." The teacher's website also said MrsP.com "will thrill your eager readers for hours" - although warning "do not even try this one on a slow connection." <ref>[http://www.teachersfirst.com/single.cfm?id=9687 TeachersFirst.com, MrsP.com review, May 2009]</ref>
On May 27, 2009, MrsP.com was chosen by the American Library Association as one of its "Great Web Sites for Kids." <ref>[http://www.ala.org/gwstemplate.cfm?section=greatwebsites&template=/cfapps/gws/displaysection.cfm&sec=19 American Library Association website]</ref>
== References == {{reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.mrsp.com Mrs. P's Magic Library]
[[Category:Entertainment websites]]

{{pp-protected|reason=Persistent [[WP:Disruptive editing|disruptive editing]]|expiry=18:47, 27 December 2018|small=yes}} {{Short description|shooting on July 10, 2016}} {{Use American English|date=October 2018}} {{Use mdy dates|date=October 2018}} {{infobox event | title = | image = | image_name = | caption = Seth Rich | date = {{start date|2016|7|10}} | time = 4:20 a.m. EST (approximate) | place = [[Bloomingdale (Washington, D.C.)|Bloomingdale]] neighborhood
([[Neighborhoods in Washington, D.C.|Ward 5]], [[Washington, D.C.]]) | coordinates = | also known as = | cause = Shooting | first reporter = | filmed by = | outcome = | reported injuries = | reported death(s) = | burial = | inquiries = [[Metropolitan Police Department of the District of Columbia]] | inquest = | coroner = Office of the Chief Medical Examiner, Washington D.C. | suspects = | charges = | verdict = | convictions = | publication bans = | litigation = }} The '''murder of Seth Rich''' occurred on Sunday, July 10, 2016, at 4:20 a.m. in the [[Bloomingdale (Washington, D.C.)|Bloomingdale]] neighborhood of [[Washington, D.C.]]{{cite news |last=Morton |first=Joseph |url=http://www.omaha.com/news/crime/d-c-police-family-of-slain-dnc-staffer-seth-rich/article_dc98d83c-c674-5136-b681-b20d930fcb0c.html |title=D.C. police, family of slain DNC staffer Seth Rich urge anyone with information about murder to come forward |work=Omaha World-Herald |date=August 4, 2016 |accessdate=February 11, 2018}} Rich died from two shots to the back. The 27-year-old Rich was an employee of the [[Democratic National Committee]] (DNC), and his murder spawned several [[Right-wing politics|right-wing]] [[conspiracy theory|conspiracy theories]],{{Cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/17/us/seth-rich-dnc-wikileaks.html |title=How the Murder of a D.N.C. Staffer Fueled Conspiracy Theories |last=Bromwich |first=Jonah Engel |date=May 17, 2017 |work=[[The New York Times]]|access-date=May 17, 2017}} including the false claim that Rich had been involved with the [[2016 Democratic National Committee email leak|leaked DNC emails in 2016]], contradicted by the law enforcement branches that investigated the murder. It was also contradicted by the July 2018 indictment of 12 Russian military intelligence agents for hacking the e-mail accounts and networks of Democratic Party officials[https://www.cnn.com/2018/07/13/politics/russia-investigation-indictments/index.html 12 Russians indicted in Mueller investigation]. [[CNN.com]], July 13, 2018 and by the U.S. intelligence community's conclusion the leaked DNC emails were part of [[Russian interference in the 2016 United States elections]].{{Cite news |first=Eugene |last=Kiely |url=http://www.factcheck.org/2017/05/gingrich-spreads-conspiracy-theory/ |title=Gingrich Spreads Conspiracy Theory |work=[[FactCheck.org]] |date=May 22, 2017|access-date=May 23, 2017 |publisher=[[Annenberg Public Policy Center]] |quote=At this point in the investigation, it is believed that Seth Rich was the victim of an attempted robbery. The assertions put forward by Mr. Wheeler are unfounded.}}{{cite news |url=http://www.politifact.com/punditfact/statements/2017/may/23/newt-gingrich/claim-slain-dnc-staffer-seth-rich-gave-emails-wiki/ |work=[[PolitiFact.com]] |title=The baseless claim that slain DNC staffer Seth Rich gave emails to WikiLeaks |date=May 23, 2017 |first=Lauren |last=Carroll|editor1-first=Katie|editor1-last=Sanders |publisher=[[Tampa Bay Times]] |quote=There is no trustworthy evidence supporting the theory that Rich was WikiLeaks' source for thousands of DNC emails. The police believe his death was the result of a botched robbery, not a political assassination.}}{{cite news |title=Cyber-spying: Bear on bear |url=https://www.economist.com/news/united-states/21707574-whats-worse-being-attacked-russian-hacker-being-attacked-two-bear-bear |work=[[The Economist]] |date=September 22, 2016 |accessdate=May 21, 2017}} [[Fact-checking websites]] like [[PolitiFact.com]], [[Snopes.com]], and [[FactCheck.org]] stated that these theories were false and unfounded. ''[[The New York Times]]'', ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'', and ''[[The Washington Post]]'' wrote that the promotion of these conspiracy theories was an example of [[fake news]].{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/24/business/media/seth-rich-fox-news-sean-hannity.html |title=Sean Hannity, a Murder and Why Fake News Endures |first=Jim |last=Rutenberg |date=May 24, 2017 |newspaper=[[The New York Times]]}}{{Cite news |last=Weigel |first=David |authorlink=David Weigel |date=May 20, 2017 |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/the-fix/wp/2017/05/20/the-seth-rich-conspiracy-shows-how-fake-news-still-works/ |title=The Seth Rich conspiracy shows how fake news still works |work=[[The Washington Post]] |access-date=May 21, 2017}} Rich's parents condemned the conspiracy theorists and said that these individuals were exploiting their son's death for political gain, and their spokesperson called the conspiracy theorists "disgusting sociopaths".{{cite news |title=We're Seth Rich's parents. Stop politicizing our son's murder. |work=[[The Washington Post]] |date=May 23, 2017 |first1=Mary |last1=Rich |first2=Joel |last2=Rich |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/were-seth-richs-parents-stop-politicizing-our-sons-murder/2017/05/23/164cf4dc-3fee-11e7-9869-bac8b446820a_story.html|access-date=May 23, 2017 |quote=We ask those purveying falsehoods to give us peace, and to give law enforcement the time and space to do the investigation they need to solve our son's murder.}}{{Cite news |url=http://forward.com/fast-forward/372070/seth-rich-parents-refute-new-claims-on-wikileaks-contact/ |title=Seth Rich Parents Refute New Claims On Wikileaks Contact |work=[[The Forward]]|access-date=May 17, 2017}}{{Cite news |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/public-safety/family-of-slain-dnc-staffer-fights-back-against-conpiracy-theories-with-cease-and-desist-letter/2017/05/20/6da279c2-3d6f-11e7-8854-21f359183e8c_story.html |title=Family of slain DNC staffer Seth Rich sends 'cease and desist' letter to Fox News contributor |last=Stein |first=Perry |newspaper=[[The Washington Post]] |date=May 20, 2017|access-date=May 21, 2017}} They requested a retraction and apology from [[Fox News]] after the network promoted the conspiracy theory, and sent a [[cease and desist]] letter to the investigator Fox News used. The investigator stated that he had no evidence to back up the claims which Fox News attributed to him.{{cite news |date=May 23, 2017 |url=http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2017/05/23/statement-on-coverage-seth-rich-murder-investigation.html |publisher=[[Fox News]] |title=Statement on coverage of Seth Rich murder investigation |quote=On May 16, a story was posted on the Fox News website on the investigation into the 2016 murder of DNC Staffer Seth Rich. The article was not initially subjected to the high degree of editorial scrutiny we require for all our reporting. Upon appropriate review, the article was found not to meet those standards and has since been removed. We will continue to investigate this story and will provide updates as warranted.|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170523182512/http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2017/05/23/statement-on-coverage-seth-rich-murder-investigation.html|archive-date=May 23, 2017}} Fox News issued a retraction, but did not apologize or publicly explain what went wrong.{{Cite news |url=https://www.npr.org/2017/09/15/551163406/fox-news-has-yet-to-explain-what-what-wrong-in-seth-rich-story |title=No Apology, No Explanation: Fox News And The Seth Rich Story |work=NPR.org|access-date=September 15, 2017 |language=en}} In return, the Rich family filed a defamation lawsuit against Fox News in March 2018,{{cite web |last=Grynbaum |first=Michael M. |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/03/13/business/fox-news-seth-rich-lawsuit.html |title=Family of Seth Rich Sues Fox News Over Retracted Article |publisher=[[The New York Times]] |date=March 13, 2018}} which was dismissed in August 2018, when a judge ruled that the plaintiffs failed to prove "extreme and outrageous" conduct by the defendants under the legal standard. ==Seth Rich's early life and career== Rich grew up in a Jewish family in [[Omaha, Nebraska]].{{cite news |url=http://www.omaha.com/obits/rich-seth-c/article_957ece9b-67c3-53d6-b88b-0c78d813b299.html |title=Rich, Seth C. |newspaper=[[Omaha World-Herald]] |date=July 13, 2016}}{{cite news |last=Hermann |first=Peter |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/true-crime/wp/2016/07/12/hillary-clinton-invokes-name-of-slain-dnc-aide-seth-rich-in-calling-for-gun-control |title=Hillary Clinton invokes name of slain DNC aide Seth Rich in calling for gun control |newspaper=[[The Washington Post]] |date=July 12, 2016}}[http://www.jta.org/2017/05/24/news-opinion/united-states/parents-of-slain-dnc-staffer-seth-rich-decry-politicization-of-their-sons-murder Parents of slain DNC staffer Seth Rich decry politicization of their son’s murder] May 24, 2017, Jewish Telegraphic Agency He volunteered for the Nebraska Democratic Party, interned for Senator [[Ben Nelson]], was active in [[Jewish outreach]],[http://www.timesofisrael.com/seth-richs-family-calls-on-fox-to-retract-wikileaks-allegations Seth Rich’s family calls on Fox to retract WikiLeaks allegations] By Jewish Telegraphic Agency, in [[Times of Israel]], May 19, 2017 and worked with the [[United States Census Bureau]].{{cite news |last=Morton |first=Joseph |url=http://www.omaha.com/news/crime/year-old-creighton-grad-dnc-staffer-shot-dead-in-d/article_023644eb-87b4-5c36-be7b-3edf96d02ebe.html |title=27-year-old Creighton grad, DNC staffer shot dead in D.C. wanted 'to try to save the world' |work=Omaha World-Herald |date=July 13, 2016 |accessdate=May 29, 2017}}{{cite news |url=http://www.jewishomaha.org/jewish-press/2016/seth-conrad-rich/ |title=In Memoriam: Seth Conrad Rich |work=The Jewish Press |location=Omaha |date=July 22, 2016 |author=Abraham, Rabbi Steven}} Eulogy given by Rabbi Steven Abraham of Beth El Synagogue at the service on July 13, 2016. In 2011, he graduated from [[Creighton University]] with a degree in [[political science]].{{cite news |last=Orti |first=Camila |url=http://www.ketv.com/article/creighton-grad-living-in-d-c-killed-in-weekend-shooting/7661364 |title=Creighton grad living in D.C. killed in weekend shooting |date=July 12, 2016 |publisher=KETV |accessdate=May 29, 2017}} He moved to Washington, D.C. to work for pollster [[Greenberg Quinlan Rosner]]. In 2014 he began working for the [[Democratic National Committee]] (DNC) as the Voter Expansion Data Director. One of his tasks at the DNC was the development of a computer application to help voters locate polling stations.{{cite news |author=Mallory Hughes |url=http://www.wusa9.com/news/local/dc/dc-man-fatally-shot-investigation-underway/269559837 |title=DNC Employee Fatally Shot in DC |publisher=[[WUSA (TV)|WUSA]] |date=August 11, 2016 |accessdate=September 2, 2016}}{{cite news |last=Rojas |first=Warren |title=DNC Staffer Killed in DC |url=http://www.rollcall.com/news/politics/dnc-staffer-seth-conrad-rich-murder-dc |work=[[Roll Call]] |date=July 11, 2016}} ==Shooting and death== On Sunday, July 10, 2016, at 4:20 a.m., Rich was shot about a block from his apartment at the southwest corner of Flagler Place and W Street Northwesthttps://www.washingtonpost.com/local/public-safety/bloomingdale-residents-question-police-after-killing-robberies-in-neighborhood/2016/07/19/99ce212c-4dab-11e6-a7d8-13d06b37f256_story.html?utm_term=.782931ca3abc in the [[Bloomingdale (Washington, D.C.)|Bloomingdale]] neighborhood of Washington, D.C.{{cite news |last=Stein |first=Jeff |title=Seth Rich: Inside the Killing of the DNC Staffer |url=http://www.newsweek.com/seth-rich-murder-dnc-hack-julian-assange-hillary-clinton-donald-trump-492084 |work=[[Newsweek]] |date=August 20, 2016}}(August 5, 2016). [http://www.nbcwashington.com/news/local/Seth-Rich-Murder-Investigation-389218672.html Mother, Police Seeking Tips on Killing of DNC Staffer Seth Rich], [[WRC-TV]]. retrieved August 22, 2016.{{cite news |last=Shrier |first=Adam |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/crime/washington-dnc-staffer-seth-conrad-rich-shot-killed-article-1.2707538 |title=Democratic National Committee staffer killed in Washington, D.C. shooting |work=[[New York Daily News]] |date=July 11, 2016 |accessdate=February 11, 2018}} Earlier that night he had been at Lou's City Bar, a sports pub {{convert|1.8|mi|km}} from his apartment, in [[Columbia Heights (Washington, D.C.)|Columbia Heights]], where he was a regular customer. He left when the bar was closing, at about 1:30 or 1:45 a.m.{{cite news |first=Clark |last=Mindock |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/us-politics/seth-rich-who-is-he-wikileaks-murder-hillary-clinton-conspiracy-explained-a7739606.html |title=Who is Seth Rich – and was his death really connected to Hillary Clinton? |newspaper=[[The Independent]] |date=May 16, 2017 |accessdate=May 22, 2017}} Police were alerted to gunfire at 4:20 a.m. by an automated [[gunfire locator]].{{cite news |last1=Hermann |first1=Peter |last2=Williams |first2=Clarence |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/public-safety/police-identify-man-fatally-shot-in-bloomingdale/2016/07/11/4236fd1a-4754-11e6-90a8-fb84201e0645_story.html |title=Slain Democratic National Committee staffer 'wanted to make a difference' |work=[[The Washington Post]] |date=July 11, 2016}} Within approximately one minute after the gun shots, police officers found Rich conscious with multiple gunshot wounds. He was transported to a nearby hospital, where he later died.{{Cite web |url=https://mpdc.dc.gov/release/homicide-2100-block-flagler-place-northwest |title=Homicide: 2100 Block of Flagler Place, Northwest {{!}} mpdc |last= |first= |date=July 11, 2016 |publisher=[[Metropolitan Police Department of the District of Columbia]]|language=en|access-date=May 25, 2017}}{{Cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/seth-rich-washington-dc-murder-victim-political-meme-weirdest-presidential-election-a7535856.html |title=The DC murder victim who became a political meme |last=Roig-Franzia |first=Manuel |date=January 19, 2017 |work=[[The Independent]] |access-date=May 25, 2017}}Khan, Mariam. [http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/dnc-employee-shot-dead-dc-weekend/story?id=40498551 DNC Employee Shot Dead in DC Over the Weekend], [[ABC News]], July 11, 2016. According to police, he died from two shots to the back and may have been killed in an attempted robbery, noting that the neighborhood had recently been plagued by robberies. Rich's mother told [[NBC News|NBC]]'s Washington affiliate [[WRC-TV]], "There had been a struggle. His hands were bruised, his knees are bruised, his face is bruised, and yet he had two shots to his back, and yet they never took anything... They didn't finish robbing him, they just took his life."{{cite news |url=http://www.nbcwashington.com/news/local/Man-Shot-Killed-in-Northwest-DC-386316391.html |title=27-Year-Old DNC Staffer Seth Rich Shot, Killed in Northwest DC |date=July 11, 2016 |author1=Collins, Pat |author2=Swalec, Andrea |publisher=[[WRC-TV]]}} The police told the family they had located a surveillance recording showing a glimpse of the legs of two people who could possibly be the killers. ==Aftermath== On the day after the shooting, DNC Chair [[Debbie Wasserman Schultz]] issued a statement mourning his loss and praising Rich's work to support [[voter rights]]. Two days after the shooting, [[Hillary Clinton]] spoke of his death during a speech advocating [[gun control|limiting the availability of guns]]. [[File:Seth Rich memorial.jpg|thumb|Bike rack and plaque outside the DNC headquarters]] In September 2016, Rich's parents and girlfriend appeared on the syndicated television show ''[[Crime Watch Daily]]'' to speak about the murder case.{{cite news |url=http://komonews.com/news/nation-world/family-of-murdered-dnc-employee-seth-rich-speaks-out-on-crime-watch |title=Family of murdered DNC employee Seth Rich speaks out on 'Crime Watch' |publisher=[[KOMO-TV]] |date=September 30, 2016 |accessdate=October 4, 2016}}{{cite news |last=Kurzius |first=Rachel |url=http://dcist.com/2016/10/seth_rich_family_interview.php |title=Murdered DNC Staffer's Mom: 'Seth Would Be So Offended' By Conspiracy Theories |publisher=[[DCist]] |date=October 3, 2016 |accessdate=October 4, 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161003165726/http://dcist.com/2016/10/seth_rich_family_interview.php |archivedate=October 3, 2016 }} In October 2016, a plaque and bike rack outside the DNC headquarters were dedicated to Rich's memory.{{cite news |last=Burdine |first=Nikki |url=http://www.wusa9.com/news/local/dnc-honors-murdered-staffer-seth-rich/337062646 |title=DNC honors murdered staffer Seth Rich |publisher=[[WUSA (TV)|WUSA]] |date=October 17, 2016 |accessdate=October 19, 2016}} In February 2017, the Beth El Synagogue in Omaha named after Rich an existing scholarship that helps Jewish children attend summer camps.{{cite news |last=Kelly |first=Michael |url=http://www.omaha.com/columnists/kelly/kelly-camp-scholarship-memorializes-omahan-seth-rich-who-was-killed/article_e3bdbe5d-ca21-5903-9ec0-9239ae56773c.html |title=Kelly: Camp scholarship memorializes Omahan Seth Rich, who was killed in D.C. in July |date=February 25, 2017 |work=[[Omaha World-Herald]] |accessdate=February 26, 2017}} The Rich family accepted the ''pro bono'' public relations services of Republican lobbyist [[Jack Burkman]] in September 2016. The Rich family and Burkman held a joint press conference on the murder in November 2016.{{cite news |last=Guttman |first=Nathan |url=http://forward.com/fast-forward/364918/fury-at-conspiracy-theory-attorney-from-family-of-murdered-dnc-staffer/ |title=Seth Rich's Family Furious At Attorney For Claiming Russia Behind The Murder |work=[[The Forward]] |accessdate=May 27, 2017}} In January 2017, Burkman launched an advertising campaign in Northwest D.C. searching for information regarding Seth's death. This included billboard advertisements and canvassing with flyers.{{cite news |url=http://www.nbcwashington.com/news/local/Who-Murdered-Seth-Rich-Billboards-Ads-to-be-Posted-in-Search-of-Killer-411119145.html |title='Who Murdered Seth Rich?': Billboards to be Posted in DC |publisher=[[WRC-TV]] |date=January 18, 2017 |accessdate=May 27, 2017}}{{cite AV Media |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UX8cLniIfOI |title=Searching for clues in the Seth Rich murder |date=May 11, 2017 |publisher=The Washington Post |accessdate=May 27, 2017 |via=YouTube}} In late February, Burkman told media outlets he had a lead that the Russian government was involved in Rich's death,{{cite web |last=Guttman |first=Nathan |url=http://forward.com/fast-forward/364499/was-russia-behind-mystery-murder-of-dnc-worker-seth-rich/ |title=Was Russia Behind Mystery Murder Of DNC Worker Seth Rich? |work=Forward |date=March 1, 2017 |accessdate=May 27, 2017}} and the Rich family then distanced itself from Burkman.{{cite web |last=Kurzius |first=Rachel |url=http://dcist.com/2017/03/seth_rich_russian_conspiracy_burkman.php |title='It's Hurtful': Seth Rich's Family Responds To Latest Conspiracy Theory About His Murder |work=DCist |date=March 2, 2017 |accessdate=June 1, 2017 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170714232639/http://dcist.com/2017/03/seth_rich_russian_conspiracy_burkman.php |archivedate=July 14, 2017 }} On March 19, 2017, Rich's brother, Aaron, started a [[GoFundMe]] campaign to try to raise $200,000 for private investigation, public outreach activities, and a reward fund.{{cite news |url=http://www.nbcwashington.com/news/local/Seth-Rich-Family-Seeks-Funds-to-Hire-Help-in-Mans-Death-416770403.html |title=Family Seeks Funds for Answers, Leads in Seth Rich Death |publisher=[[WRC-TV]] |accessdate=March 22, 2017}} The Rich family was approached by [[Ed Butowsky]] (a friend of Trump advisor [[Steve Bannon]] and a frequent Fox News contributor), who recommended having Fox News contributor and former homicide detective Rod Wheeler investigate Seth's murder. Butowsky said Wheeler had been recommended to him. The family gave Wheeler permission to investigate, though they did not hire him.{{cite web |last=Collins |first=Ben |url=http://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2017/05/16/the-big-money-pr-war-over-seth-richs-death |title=The Big-Money PR War Over Seth Rich's Death |date=May 16, 2017 |work=The Daily Beast |accessdate=May 27, 2017}} When questioned by CNN, Butowsky denied involvement in the case, but later admitted he was involved and had offered to pay Wheeler's fees.{{cite web |url=https://www.dallasnews.com/news/dallas/2017/05/19/dallas-financier-got-tangled-conspiracy-theories-slaying-dnc-staffer-seth-rich |title=How a Dallas financier got tangled up in conspiracy theories about slaying of DNC staffer Seth Rich |last=Chiquillo |first=Julieta |date=May 19, 2017 |work=Dallas News |accessdate=May 31, 2017}}{{cite web |last=Rutenberg |first=Jim |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/24/business/media/seth-rich-fox-news-sean-hannity.html |title=Sean Hannity, a Murder and Why Fake News Endures |date=May 24, 2017 |work=The New York Times |accessdate=May 31, 2017}} After Wheeler asserted links between Rich and Wikileaks in a Fox affiliate interview on May 15, 2017—an assertion he later backpedaled from{{cite web |date=May 15, 2017 |last=Marraco |first=Marina |title=Family's private investigator: There is evidence Seth Rich had contact with WikiLeaks prior to death |url=http://www.fox5dc.com/news/local-news/254852337-story|access-date=June 13, 2017}}—the family spokesman said that the family regretted working with Wheeler. Wheeler then sued Fox News on August 1, 2017, for mental anguish and emotional distress, alleging that he had been misquoted in a story that was then published on the urging of Trump.{{cite web |url=http://thehill.com/homenews/media/344745-lawsuit-claims-trump-involvement-in-retracted-fox-story-on-seth-rich |title=Lawsuit claims Trump involvement in retracted Fox story on Seth Rich |first=Ian |last=Swanson |date=August 1, 2017 |work=The Hill}} ==Rewards== The [[Metropolitan Police Department of the District of Columbia]] (MPDC) posted its customary reward of $25,000 for information about the death.{{cite news |author=Harris, Chris |url=http://www.people.com/article/friends-remember-dnc-staffer-seth-rich |title=Friends of Slain DNC Staffer Seth Rich Remember Him as 'Honest' and 'Self-Sacrificing' |work=[[People (magazine)|People]] |date=July 13, 2016}} On August 9, 2016, [[WikiLeaks]] announced a $20,000 reward for information about Rich's murder leading to a conviction,{{cite news |first=Stephen |last=Tschida |title=WikiLeaks offering $20,000 reward for information regarding D.C. murder of DNC's Seth Rich |url=http://wjla.com/news/local/wikileaks-offering-20000-reward-for-information-regarding-dc-murder-of-dncs-seth-rich |publisher=[[WJLA-TV]] |date=August 9, 2016 |accessdate=May 23, 2017}}{{cite news |last1=Hermann |first1=Peter |last2=Williams |first2=Clarence |date=August 9, 2016 |title=WikiLeaks offers reward for help finding DNC staffer's killer |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/public-safety/wikileaks-offers-reward-in-killing-of-dnc-staffer-in-washington/2016/08/09/f84fcbf4-5e5b-11e6-8e45-477372e89d78_story.html |newspaper=[[The Washington Post]] |accessdate=May 21, 2017}}{{cite news |date=August 10, 2016 |publisher=[[Fox News]] |title=Assange implies murdered DNC staffer was WikiLeaks' source |url=http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2016/08/10/assange-implies-murdered-dnc-staffer-was-wikileaks-source.html |accessdate=May 21, 2017}} although Rich's family said they were unable to verify this reward offer.{{cite news |url=http://www.omaha.com/news/metro/parents-of-dnc-staffer-seth-rich-vow-to-find-his/article_b55fc7c9-e5d7-5e25-9e80-c7d2a264441b.html |title=Parents of DNC staffer Seth Rich vow to find his killer; reward now $125,000 |last1=Morton |first1=Joseph |date=November 23, 2016 |work=[[Omaha World Herald]] |accessdate=January 23, 2017}} WikiLeaks stated that this offer should not be taken as implying Rich had been involved in leaking information to them. In November 2016, Republican lobbyist [[Jack Burkman]] said he was personally offering a $100,000 reward in addition to those announced by the police department and WikiLeaks, and he added another $5,000 to his offer in December and another $25,000 in January.{{cite news |last=Roig-Franzia |first=Manuel |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/style/seth-rich-wasnt-just-another-dc-murder-victim-he-was-a-meme-in-the-weirdest-presidential-election-of-our-times/2017/01/18/ee8e27f8-dcc0-11e6-918c-99ede3c8cafa_story.html |title=Seth Rich wasn't just another D.C. murder victim. He was a meme in the weirdest presidential election of our times |work=[[The Washington Post]] |date=January 18, 2017}}{{cite news |url=http://wjla.com/news/local/gop-lobbyist-adds-5k-to-reward-for-info-on-murder-of-former-dnc-staffer-seth-rich |title=GOP lobbyist adds $5K to reward for info on murder of former DNC staffer Seth Rich |publisher=[[WJLA-TV]] |date=December 5, 2016 |accessdate=May 28, 2017}} Burkman said he hoped the money would help "get to the truth of what happened here and will either debunk the conspiracy theories or validate them".{{cite news |last=Kutner |first=Max |url=http://www.newsweek.com/gop-lobbyist-reward-seth-rich-dnc-499653 |title=A GOP lobbyist will pay $100,000 to learn who killed DNC staffer Seth Rich |date=September 16, 2016 |work=[[Newsweek]] |accessdate=May 26, 2017}} ==Conspiracy theories== ===Origins=== Right-wing conspiracy theories began circulating in the days following Rich's death, including false claims that his murder was connected to the [[2016 Democratic National Committee email leak|DNC email leak of 2016]], or the FBI's investigation of the [[Clinton Foundation]].{{cite web |first=Kim |last=LaCapria |url=http://www.snopes.com/seth-conrad-rich/ |title=Seth Rich Homicide |publisher=[[Snopes.com]] |date=July 14, 2016}}{{cite web |last=Whitehouse |first=John |url=https://www.salon.com/2017/05/27/how-the-murder-of-a-dnc-staffer-turned-into-a-right-wing-conspiracy_partner/ |title=How the murder of a DNC staffer turned into a right-wing conspiracy |date=May 27, 2017 |work=Salon |accessdate=March 14, 2018}} A post on Twitter before Rich's memorial service originated the idea that his killing was a political assassination.{{cite news |url=http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2017/05/is-this-even-about-seth-rich-at-all.html |work=[[New York (magazine)|New York]] |title='Is This Even About Seth Rich at All?' |first=Olivia |last=Nuzzi |date=May 28, 2017}} Subsequently, the conspiracy theory was spread on the subreddit [[/r/The Donald]], and on July 29, 2016, the website ''[[Heat Street]]'' reported on these [[Reddit]] posts.{{cite news |last=Zanotti |first=Emily |url=http://heatst.com:80/politics/still-no-clues-in-murder-of-dncs-seth-rich-as-conspiracy-theories-thicken/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160930120844/http://heatst.com/politics/still-no-clues-in-murder-of-dncs-seth-rich-as-conspiracy-theories-thicken/ |title=Dem Aide Seth Rich's Death Still Inspiring Conspiracy Theories |dead-url=yes |date=July 29, 2016 |archive-date=September 30, 2016 |work=Heat Street |accessdate=March 14, 2018 |df=mdy-all}} Reddit users attempted to tie the homicide to prior "[[Clinton Body Count]]" conspiracy theories.{{cite web |url=https://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2017/5/24/15685560/seth-rich-conspiracy-theory-explained-fox-news-hannity |publisher=[[Vox.com]] |title=The bonkers Seth Rich conspiracy theory, explained |date=May 24, 2017 |first=Jeff |last=Guo}} The conspiracy theory was later popularized by Donald Trump political adviser [[Roger Stone]] via his Twitter account. According to British journalist [[Duncan Campbell (journalist)|Duncan Campbell]], the Russian intelligence agency, GRU, tried to implicate Rich as the source of the stolen DNC emails, in order to draw attention away from themselves.{{cite news |last=Campbell |first=Duncan |url=https://www.computerweekly.com/news/252445769/Briton-ran-pro-Kremlin-disinformation-campaign-that-helped-Trump-deny-Russian-links |title=Briton ran pro-Kremlin disinformation campaign that helped Trump deny Russian links |date=July 31, 2018 |publisher=Computer Weekly |accessdate=October 31, 2018}} Datestamps on the DNC files were altered to show the data had been obtained on July 5, 2016, five days before Rich's death, and the timezone was changed to Eastern Time, within which Washington, D.C. falls. Guccifer 2.0, the alleged GRU front that provided the emails to Wikileaks, then reported that Rich had been their source. Based partly on their acceptance of the false dates, some experts then concluded that the emails had been copied in the DNC offices, and had not been hacked from outside. Tucker, Patrick (August 2, 2018). [https://www.defenseone.com/technology/2018/08/how-russian-hackers-amplified-seth-rich-conspiracy-until-it-reached-donald-trump-and-cia/150263/ "A new report claims that Russian hackers altered dates in stolen documents to frame the DNC staffer for the theft."] ''Defense One''. Retrieved August 25, 2018. ====WikiLeaks statements==== [[Julian Assange]], the founder of WikiLeaks, fueled the speculation in an interview with ''[[Nieuwsuur]]'' published on August 9, 2016, which touched on the topic of risks faced by WikiLeaks' sources.{{cite web |url=https://nos.nl/nieuwsuur/artikel/2124316-assange-belooft-nieuwe-onthullingen-over-clinton.html |title=Assange belooft nieuwe onthullingen over Clinton |first= |last=Nieuwsuur |date=August 9, 2016 |language=Dutch |publisher=Nieuwsuur |via=YouTube}} Unbidden, Assange brought up the case of Seth Rich. When asked directly whether Rich was a source, Assange nodded, then said "we don't comment on who our sources are".{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kp7FkLBRpKg |title=Julian Assange on Seth Rich |first= |last=Nieuwsuur |date=August 9, 2016 |publisher= |via=YouTube}} Subsequent statements by WikiLeaks emphasized that the organization was not naming Rich as a source.{{cite news |last=Morton |first=Joseph |url=http://www.omaha.com/news/crime/wikileaks-offers-reward-for-help-finding-omaha-native-seth-rich/article_cfb287bc-5e98-11e6-ae0c-8b471b8cbfbb.html |title=WikiLeaks offers $20,000 reward for help finding Omaha native Seth Rich's killer |work=[[Omaha World-Herald]] |date=August 10, 2016 |accessdate=February 11, 2018}} For context, Assange was well-known as a longtime critic of Clinton,{{cite web |url=https://www.politico.com/story/2010/11/assange-clinton-should-quit-045756 |title=Assange: Clinton should quit |first=Jennifer |last=Epstein |date=November 30, 2010 |publisher=Politico}} and it subsequently came to light that WikiLeaks communicated with the Trump campaign over other issues, casting doubt on Assange's motivation.{{cite web |url=https://theintercept.com/2017/11/15/wikileaks-julian-assange-donald-trump-jr-hillary-clinton/ |title=Julian Assange's Hatred of Hillary Clinton Was No Secret. His Advice to Donald Trump Was. |first=Robert |last=Mackey |date=November 17, 2016 |publisher=The Intercept}} In April 2018, Twitter direct messages revealed that even as Assange was suggesting publicly that WikiLeaks had obtained emails from Seth Rich, Assange was trying to obtain more emails from the hacker [[Guccifer 2.0]], who was at the time suspected of being linked to Russian intelligence. ''BuzzFeed'' described the messages as "the starkest proof yet that Assange knew a likely Russian government hacker had the Democrat leaks he wanted. And they reveal the deliberate bad faith with which Assange fed the groundless claims that Rich was his source, even as he knew the documents' origin."{{cite news |last=Collier |first=Kevin |url=https://www.buzzfeed.com/kevincollier/assange-seth-rich-lies-guccifer-wikileaks-hannity |title=These Messages Show Julian Assange Talked About Seeking Hacked Files From Guccifer 2.0 |work=BuzzFeed News |date=April 5, 2018 |accessdate=April 7, 2018}} WikiLeaks' supporters on social media argued Assange's actions were consistent with WikiLeaks' mission.{{cite web |last=Gilmour |first=David |url=https://www.dailydot.com/layer8/guccifer-wikileaks-seth-rich/ |title=Does the Guccifer-WikiLeaks Story Exonerate Seth Rich? |date=April 6, 2018 |work=The Daily Dot |accessdate=April 7, 2018}} ====Spread by social media and right wing==== These conspiracy theories were promoted by [[Mike Cernovich]], [[Sean Hannity]], [[Geraldo Rivera]], [[Kim Dotcom]], [[Paul Joseph Watson]], [[Newt Gingrich]], [[Jack Posobiec]], and others.{{Cite web |url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/world/americas/donald-trumps-america/92735833/in-protrump-media-land-the-last-weeks-been-irrelevant-or-just-fake-news |title=In Pro-Trump media land, the last week's been irrelevant or just 'fake news' |website=Stuff|access-date=May 26, 2017}}{{Cite news |url=http://www.newsweek.com/seth-rich-dnc-staffer-wikileaks-leaked-emails-fbi-610383 |title=The FBI is not investigating DNC staffer Seth Rich's murder, despite WikiLeaks claim |date=May 17, 2017 |work=Newsweek|access-date=May 26, 2017 |language=en}}{{cite news |url=https://www.buzzfeed.com/janelytvynenko/jack-posobiec-out-at-the-rebel |title=Pro-Trump Media Figure And Conspiracy Theory Peddler Jack Posobiec Is Out At The Rebel |publisher=[[BuzzFeed]] |date=May 29, 2017 |first=Jane |last=Lytvynenko}} The same venues that fomented the false [[Pizzagate|Pizzagate conspiracy theory]] helped to promulgate the Seth Rich murder conspiracy theories,{{cite news |work=[[Los Angeles Times]] |date=May 24, 2017 |title=How Seth Rich's death became an Internet conspiracy theory |url=http://www.latimes.com/business/hollywood/la-fi-ct-seth-rich-conspiracy-20170523-htmlstory.html |first=Colleen |last=Shalby |quote=Despite police statements and Rich's family concluding that his death was the result of an attempted robbery, the rumor spread within the same circles that churned out the bogus 'PizzaGate' story}}{{citation |first=Ed |last=Stetzer |work=[[Christianity Today]] |url=http://www.christianitytoday.com/edstetzer/2017/may/christians-repent-conspiracy-theory-fake-news.html |title=Christians, Repent (Yes, Repent) of Spreading Conspiracy Theories and Fake News—It's Bearing False Witness |date=May 31, 2017 |quote=And now I noticed that many of the same conservative Christians who shared about #pizzagate have been spreading the #SethRich conspiracy theory.}} and each shared similar features.{{Cite news |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/style/a-conspiratorial-tale-of-murder-with-fox-news-at-the-center/2017/05/17/6a4d1f5a-3b14-11e7-a058-ddbb23c75d82_story.html |title=A conspiratorial tale of murder, with Fox News at the center |last=Farhi |first=Paul |date=May 17, 2017 |work=[[The Washington Post]] |accessdate=May 18, 2017 |quote=The Rich story has taken on elements of the Comet Ping Pong conspiracy, a false and preposterous tale involving Hillary Clinton and her supposed operation of a child-abuse ring at a District pizza restaurant.}}{{citation |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |url=https://www.yahoo.com/news/critics-notebook-sean-hannity-returns-talk-not-talking-044105050.html |last=Scheck |first=Frank |date=May 31, 2017 |title=Critic's Notebook: Sean Hannity Returns to Talk About Not Talking About the Seth Rich Conspiracy Theory |quote=So it's only a matter of time before another lunatic, like the one who showed up with a loaded weapon after Pizzagate, becomes inspired to deliver vigilante-style justice.}}{{citation |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/fox-vulgar-coverage-of-murdered-dnc-staffer-is-nothing_us_591f02f5e4b0e8f558bb25b6 |work=The Huffington Post |title=Fox's Vulgar Coverage Of A Murdered DNC Staffer Is Nothing New |date=May 19, 2017 |first=Eric |last=Boehlert |quote=Basically, it was the 'alt-right' idiocy of Pizzagate all over again.}} Both were promoted by individuals subscribing to far-right politics,{{citation |url=http://nymag.com/selectall/2017/05/the-online-radicalization-were-not-talking-about.html |work=[[New York Magazine]] |quote=If you've read this week's conspiracy-mongering stories about the supposedly suspicious death of DNC employee Seth Rich — or if you've read in the past about the rise of White Student Unions on college campuses, or 'Pizzagate' — you've seen the fruits of their efforts. |title=The Online Radicalization We're Not Talking About |first=Alice |last=Marwick |date=May 18, 2017}} and by campaign officials and individuals appointed to senior-level national security roles by Donald Trump.{{citation |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/powerpost/schooled-on-benghazi-and-pizzagate-trump-team-is-heavy-on-conspiracy-theorists/2016/12/21/53bdb6d6-c7b1-11e6-8bee-54e800ef2a63_story.html |work=[[The New York Times]] |title=Schooled on Benghazi and Pizzagate, Trump team is heavy on conspiracy theorists |first=Elise |last=Viebeck |date=December 22, 2016 |quote=Many of Trump's highest-level appointees have a history of publicly promoting conspiratorial, outlandish and fringe beliefs, particularly about Muslims, the Clinton family and the environment — unproven narratives that remain stubbornly alive on the Internet despite being debunked by the mainstream media.}}{{citation |first=Noah |last=Lanard |url=https://www.washingtonian.com/2017/05/17/fox-5-seth-rich-story-disintegrated-made-no-sense/ |title=Fox 5's Nonsensical Seth Rich Story Managed to Disintegrate in a Way That Made No Sense |work=[[Washingtonian (magazine)|Washingtonian]] |quote=After being forced out of the Trump administration for promoting the Comet Ping Pong conspiracy theory, Michael Flynn Jr., the son of the former National Security Adviser, tweeted, 'So many stories to take away from the #SethRich bombshell.' |date=May 17, 2017}}{{citation |url=http://www.salon.com/2017/05/24/donald-trump-must-be-getting-desperate-does-he-really-think-thuggish-corey-lewandowski-can-save-him/ |work=Salon |quote=Seth Rich saga, which has the right-wing media in a full-blown frenzy. ... It has all the hallmarks of a Bossie-style hit although the inane Pizzagate conspiracy spread by the likes of former national security adviser Michael Flynn proves that dirty tricks can be done just as well by amateurs. |title=Donald Trump must be getting desperate: Does he really think thuggish Corey Lewandowski can save him? |first=Heather Digby |last=Parton |date=May 24, 2017}} After prior coordination on Facebook, each theory was spread on Twitter by automated bots using a branded hashtag, with the goal of becoming a trending topic.{{citation |quote=Bots flood the network, tweeting and retweeting thousands or hundreds of thousands of messages in support of the story, often accompanied by a branding hashtag — #pizzagate, or, a few weeks ago, #sethrich. |work=[[The New York Times]] |first=Farhad |last=Manjoo |authorlink=Farhad Manjoo |title=How Twitter Is Being Gamed to Feed Misinformation |date=May 31, 2017 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/31/technology/how-twitter-is-being-gamed-to-feed-misinformation.html}} Both the Pizzagate conspiracy theory and the Seth Rich murder conspiracy theory were spread in the subreddit forum /r/The Donald.{{cite news |url=http://www.ibtimes.com/reddit-news-donald-sub-set-private-maybe-done-good-update-its-back-2541584 |work=[[International Business Times]] |first=Steven |last=Asarch |title=Reddit News: The Donald Sub Set To Private, Maybe Done For Good [UPDATE: It's Back] |date=May 20, 2017 |quote=The_donald is arguably the most polarizing sub on reddit ... has become the main political subreddit for continued conspiracy theories, like Pizzagate or that the DNC murdered Seth Rich.}} In both conspiracy theories, the promoters attempted to shift the [[Burden of proof (law)|burden of proof]] — asking others to attempt to disprove their claims, without citing substantiated evidence.{{cite news |last=Kurtzleben |first=Danielle |url=https://www.npr.org/2017/05/17/528804792/unproved-claims-reemerge-around-dnc-staffer-s-death-here-s-what-you-should-know |title=Unproved Claims Re-Emerge Around DNC Staffer's Death: Here's What You Should Know |work=[[National Public Radio]] |date=May 17, 2017 |accessdate=May 28, 2017 |quote=As with many other conspiracy theories ... this kind of assertion in part functions by trying to shift the burden of proof. Rather than proving with hard evidence that there was a conspiracy surrounding Rich's murder (or that the owners of Comet Ping Pong, the pizza restaurant, were harming children), the people making the unproved claims end up pushing the other side to try to disprove it.}} ''[[Slate (magazine)|Slate]]''{{'}}s Elliot Hannon called the claims about Seth Rich a "PizzaGate-like conspiracy theory surrounding Rich's death",{{citation |url=http://www.slate.com/blogs/the_slatest/2017/05/24/hannity_says_he_will_stop_but_not_really_pushing_the_seth_rich_conspiracy.html |work=Slate |title=Hannity Says He Will Stop—But Also Never Stop—Pushing the Seth Rich Conspiracy |last=Hannon |first=Elliot |date=May 24, 2017 |quote=the PizzaGate-like conspiracy theory surrounding Rich's death}} ''[[The Huffington Post]]'' described it as "the 'alt-right' idiocy of Pizzagate all over again", [[National Public Radio|NPR]]'s [[David Folkenflik]] said Fox News coverage of it "evokes the pizza-gate terrible allegations utterly unfounded",{{citation |work=BuzzFeed News |last=Cramer |first=Meg |title=Can Fox News Survive Without Roger Ailes? |date=May 19, 2017 |url=https://www.buzzfeed.com/megcramer/can-fox-news-survive-without-roger-ailes |quote=Yesterday there was this ludicrous story that I think Seth Rich was trying to imply that this poor DNC staffer who'd been killed had been like, set up by the Clintons. ... You know, it evokes the pizza-gate terrible allegations utterly unfounded and unfair}} and [[Margaret Sullivan (journalist)|Margaret Sullivan]] wrote for ''[[The Washington Post]]'': "The Seth Rich lie has become the new Comet Ping Pong ... Crazy, baseless and dangerous."{{citation |quote=The Seth Rich lie has become the new Comet Ping Pong — another Washington-based conspiracy theory that ended in January with a gunman walking into a family-friendly pizza joint and firing shots as he 'self-investigated' a supposed child-molestation plot involving Hillary Clinton. Crazy, baseless and dangerous. |first=Margaret |last=Sullivan |authorlink=Margaret Sullivan (journalist) |url=http://www.sltrib.com/opinion/5322540-155/margaret-sullivan-the-seth-rich-lie |title=Margaret Sullivan: The Seth Rich lie, and how the corrosion of reality should worry every American |agency=[[The Washington Post]] |work=[[The Salt Lake Tribune]] |date=May 23, 2017}} ===Debunking=== The conspiracy theories have been debunked by law enforcement, as well as by [[fact-checking websites]] like [[PolitiFact.com]],{{cite web |work=[[PolitiFact.com]] |first=Joshua |last=Gillin |url=http://www.politifact.com/punditfact/statements/2017/may/26/patriotcriercom/conspiracy-theory-comey-hid-seth-richs-ties-wikile/ |title=Conspiracy theory that Comey hid Seth Rich's ties to WikiLeaks based on retracted story |date=May 26, 2017}} [[Snopes.com]], and [[FactCheck.org]].{{failed verification|date=January 2018}} The [[Metropolitan Police Department of the District of Columbia]] described the murder as related to a bungled attempted robbery, and said "the assertions put forward by Mr. Wheeler are unfounded." The FBI told PolitiFact.com that the MPD was investigating the homicide. Assistant Police Chief Peter Newsham said the police had no information suggesting a connection between Rich's death and data obtained by WikiLeaks. People who worked with Rich said he was not an expert computer hacker helping to leak information to foreigners. Andrew Therriault, a data scientist who had mentored Rich, said although he had recently been working as a programmer, this "wasn't his background", and another co-worker said Rich was very upset when he heard hackers associated with Russian intelligence services had broken into the DNC computers and could be interfering with the election. Rich family representative, Brad Bauman, responding to the conspiracy theorists' claim that the [[Federal Bureau of Investigation|FBI]] was investigating the case said, "The FBI is not now and has never been a party to this investigation." FactCheck.org analyzed statements by [[Newt Gingrich]] related to the conspiracy theory, where Gingrich said Rich "apparently was assassinated" subsequent to "having given WikiLeaks something like … 53,000 [DNC] emails and 17,000 attachments". FactCheck.org determined this claim was "unsupported" and determined "there's no evidence for his claim." PolitiFact.com said the assertion that Rich gave emails to WikiLeaks is a "baseless claim", concluding "Gingrich and others are talking about an unfounded conspiracy theory as if it's a matter of fact. It is far from it. We rate his claim Pants on Fire." In a separate analysis, PolitiFact.com concluded: "There's no evidence there's any link between Rich and WikiLeaks. The FBI has indirectly denied investigating the case, which Washington police consider a robbery gone wrong." Snopes.com looked into the matter and stated: "We were able to confirm the FBI is not investigating Rich's murder — it is an MPD investigation." Snopes contacted a spokesman for the Washington, D.C. mayor's office, who said, "All claims made by Mr. Wheeler are false and take fake news to a whole new level. The family deserves better and everyday MPD continues to work diligently to solve this case." Snopes rated the claim "DNC staffer Seth Rich sent 'thousands of leaked e-mails' to WikiLeaks before he was murdered" as "False". The fabrications were described as [[fake news]] and falsehoods by ''[[The New York Times]]''. ''The New York Times'' cited the conspiracy theories as an example of the persistence of false claims, concluding: "fake news dies hard". The ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' called the conspiracy theories "unsubstantiated rumors". ''[[The Washington Post]]'' cited the conspiracy theories as an example of the power of fake news to spread virally online. The paper used the example as a case study of the persistence of fake news, and found that television news media can be a soft target for such false stories. ''The Washington Post'' further found that the proliferation of fake news via Facebook had decreased, but remained powerful on Twitter due to spread via online bots. They found that the conspiracy theories with the largest potential to spread on the Internet were those that held attraction for both the alt-right movements and the political left wing. ''The Washington Post'' concluded that even if a particular false story had been sufficiently debunked, such fact-checking was unable to stop the spread of the falsehoods online. === Fox News retracted reporting === ====Uncorroborated story==== On May 15, 2017, [[Fox 5 DC]] (WTTG) reported the uncorroborated and later largely retracted claims by Rod Wheeler, a Fox News contributor and former homicide detective, that there was evidence Seth Rich had contacted WikiLeaks and that law enforcement were covering this up;{{cite news |last=Savransky |first=Rebecca |url=http://thehill.com/homenews/news/333555-family-of-slain-dnc-staffer-slams-report-he-had-contact-with-wikileaks |title=Slain DNC staffer's family quashes report he had contact with WikiLeaks |date=May 16, 2017 |work=[[The Hill (newspaper)|The Hill]] |accessdate=May 17, 2017}} claims that were never independently verified by Fox.{{Cite news |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/fox-news-conspiracy-theory-wikileaks-seth-rich_us_591b493ee4b07d5f6ba6d027 |title=Fox Pushes WikiLeaks Murder Conspiracy From Man Who Warned Of Armed Lesbian Pedophiles |last=Waldron |first=Travis |publisher=[[HuffPost]] |date=May 16, 2017 |accessdate=May 16, 2017}} The next day, Fox News published a lead story on its website and provided extensive coverage on its cable news channel about what it later said were Wheeler's uncorroborated claims about the murder of Seth Rich;{{Cite news |url=http://www.haaretz.com/us-news/.premium-1.789915 |title=Explained: 'Alt-right' Using Cruel Seth Rich Conspiracy Theory to Deflect From Trump's Russia Scandal |last=Sommer |first=Allison Kaplan |date=May 17, 2017 |work=[[Haaretz]]|access-date=May 21, 2017}}{{cite news |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/the-fix/wp/2017/05/16/conservative-media-coverage-of-trumps-classified-disclosure-will-make-your-head-spin/ |title=Conservative media coverage of Trump's classified disclosure will make your head spin |last=Borchers |first=Callum |work=[[Washington Post]] |date=May 16, 2017}}{{Cite news |author=Alvin Chang |url=https://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2017/5/18/15646098/right-wing-media-collective-memories |title=We tracked the Trump scandals on right-wing news sites. Here's how they covered it. |publisher=[[Vox (website)|Vox]] |date=May 18, 2017 |accessdate=May 18, 2017}} in the lead story Fox News removed from their website a few days later, they stated that Wheeler's claims had been "corroborated by a federal investigator who spoke to Fox News."{{cite web |url=http://www.newsweek.com/seth-rich-dnc-staffer-wikileaks-leaked-emails-fbi-610383 |title=The FBI is not investigating DNC staffer Seth Rich's murder, despite WikiLeaks claim |date=May 17, 2017 |publisher=}}{{cite web |last1=Zimmerman |first1=Malia |title=Family of slain DNC staffer Seth Rich blasts detective over report of WikiLeaks link |url=http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2017/05/16/slain-dnc-staffer-had-contact-with-wikileaks-investigator-says.html |publisher=Fox News |accessdate=August 5, 2017 |date=May 16, 2017 |deadurl=bot: unknown |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170516232112/http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2017/05/16/slain-dnc-staffer-had-contact-with-wikileaks-investigator-says.html#&_intcmp=latestnews |archivedate=May 16, 2017 }}{{cite news |last1=Choi |first1=David |last2=Bondarenko |first2=Veronika |title=A 27-year-old DNC staffer was shot and killed in DC — and his mysterious death led to a lawsuit against Fox News |url=http://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-seth-rich-story-about-fox-news-lawsuit-rod-wheeler-dnc-wikileaks-emails-2017-8 |work=Business Insider |date=August 2, 2017 |accessdate=August 7, 2017}} In reporting these claims, the Fox News report re-ignited conspiracy theories about the killing.{{Cite news |url=http://www.nbcnews.com/politics/white-house/dnc-staffer-s-murder-draws-fresh-conspiracy-theories-n760186 |title=DNC staffer's murder draws fresh conspiracy theories |publisher=[[NBC News]]|access-date=May 16, 2017}}{{cite news |url=http://abcnews.go.com/Blotter/fbi-involved-seth-rich-case-officials/story?id=47565705 |title=FBI is not involved in Seth Rich case despite 'conspiracy theories', officials say |date=May 22, 2017 |publisher=[[ABC News]]|access-date=May 22, 2017}} According to [[NPR]], within a day of the original Fox report, "Google searches for Rich had overtaken searches for James Comey, even amid continuous news about the former FBI director's conversations with Trump." ''[[The Washington Post]]''{{'}}s Callum Borchers noted Fox News chose to lead with this story at a time when most other media outlets were covering [[Donald Trump's disclosure of classified information to Russia]]. Other news organizations revealed Wheeler was a Donald Trump supporter, a paid Fox News contributor, and according to [[NBC News]] had "developed a reputation for making outlandish claims, such as one appearance on Fox News in 2007 in which he warned that underground networks of pink pistol-toting lesbian gangs were raping young women".{{Cite news |url=https://www.buzzfeed.com/josephbernstein/rod-wheeler |title=Meet The Private Detective Who Ignited A Clinton Conspiracy Theory |publisher=[[BuzzFeed]] |accessdate=May 17, 2017}} ''The Washington Post'' noted it is "rare for a news organization to have such a close relationship with the people it is covering", as Wheeler was "playing three roles at once: as a Fox source, as a paid contributor to the network and as a supposedly independent investigator of the murder". When Wheeler appeared on [[Sean Hannity]]'s Fox News shows, these multiple roles were not disclosed to viewers. After Wheeler's Fox News interview on May 15, 2017, Brad Bauman, a communications professional and spokesman for the Rich family, said the family was asking Fox News and the Fox affiliate to retract their reports and apologize for damaging their son's legacy. The family spokesperson, the Washington, D.C. police department, the Washington, D.C. mayor's office, the FBI, and law enforcement sources familiar with the case all disputed Wheeler's claims.{{Cite news |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/public-safety/family-of-slain-seth-rich-says-reports-he-fed-wikileaks-dnc-info-are-untrue/2017/05/16/9b32ef9c-3a46-11e7-8854-21f359183e8c_story.html |title=Family of slain Seth Rich says reports that he fed DNC info to WikiLeaks are untrue |work=[[The Washington Post]]|access-date=May 16, 2017}} The family said, "We are a family who is committed to facts, not fake evidence that surfaces every few months to fill the void and distract law enforcement and the general public from finding Seth's murderers." Bauman criticized Fox News for its reporting, saying he believed that the outlet was motivated by a desire to deflect attention from the Trump-Russia story: "I think there's a very special place in hell for people that would use the memory of a murder victim in order to pursue a political agenda."{{Cite news |url=http://www.snopes.com/seth-rich-dnc-wikileaks-murder/ |title=Fact Check: Did DNC Staffer Seth Rich Send 'Thousands of E-Mails' to WikiLeaks Before He Was Murdered? |work=[[Snopes.com]] |date=May 16, 2017|access-date=May 16, 2017 |first=Bethania |last=Palma |quote=We were able to confirm the FBI is not investigating Rich's murder — it is an MPD investigation... All claims made by Mr. Wheeler are false and take fake news to a whole new level. The family deserves better and everyday MPD continues to work diligently to solve this case.}} Later that day, Wheeler told [[CNN]] he had no evidence that Rich had contacted Wikileaks.{{Cite news |url=http://money.cnn.com/2017/05/16/media/seth-rich-family-response-claims-of-wikileaks-contact/index.html |title=Story on DNC staffer's murder dominated conservative media – hours later it fell apart |last=Darcy |first=Oliver |date=May 16, 2017 |publisher=[[CNNMoney]]|access-date=May 17, 2017}} Wheeler claimed that Fox had presented his quotes misleadingly and that he only learned about the possible existence of the evidence from a Fox News reporter.
